Key Match Events: Sri Lanka won by 4 wickets with 5 balls remaining.
Sri Lanka chased down the target of 176, scoring 179/6 in 19.1 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka's batting was in focus against unbeaten Afghanistan as the Super 4 stage got underway.
SL were all out for only 105 in the tournament opener against Afghanistan.
Chris Silverwood's focus is on bringing back Sri Lanka to their refreshing approach to white-ball cricket that revolutionised the ODI game in the 1990s.
Afghanistan have proved they're giant killers no more. UAE conditions are as good as home conditions for them.
Afghanistan haven't been tested while batting first so far in the tournament.
Sri Lanka had to go for broke in their virtual knockout against Bangladesh to stay in the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The surface in Sharjah was the same as the Pakistan v Hong Kong game, with rough patches and dry spots aiding the spinners.
Ground dimensions in Sharjah are significantly smaller than Dubai, favoring batters.
There hasn't been any dew across both venues so far.
Hazratullah Zazai and Rahmanullah Gurbaz are the second-most prolific pair for Afghanistan in T20Is with eight fifty-run stands in just 21 innings together.
In 13 T20Is this year, Sri Lanka have conceded runs at 8.21 during the powerplay at an average of 42.73, the worst among all Full Members.
Mujeeb ur Rahman has a prolific record in Sharjah with 10 wickets in four T20Is.
Others: Both sides had a fully fit squad of players to choose from and were unlikely to make changes.

Sri Lanka's playing XI: Pathum Nissanka, Kusal Mendis (wk), Charith Asalanka, Danushka Gunathilaka, Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Dasun Shanaka (capt), Wanindu Hasaranga, Chamika Karunaratne, Maheesh Theekshana, Asitha Fernando, Dilshan Madushanka.

Afghanistan's playing XI: Hazratullah Zazai, Rahmanullah Gurbaz (wk), Ibrahim Zadran, Najibullah Zadran, Mohammad Nabi (capt), Karim Janat, Rashid Khan, Azmatullah Omarzai, Naveen-ul-Haq, Mujeeb-ur-Rahman, Fazalhaq Farooqi.
